target_audience.primary_persona: Sales Representatives and Business Development Managers who need to manage customer relationships, track leads through conversion funnels, and close deals efficiently
secondary_personas: Sales Managers who need pipeline visibility and team performance metrics
Customer Success Teams who track customer interactions and activities
Marketing Teams who generate and qualify leads before handoff to sales
pain_points: Fragmented customer data across multiple systems making it hard to get a complete view
Manual lead tracking and qualification processes that waste time
Lack of visibility into deal pipeline status and conversion rates
Difficulty tracking all customer interactions and activities in one place
Missing real-time collaboration and notifications for team coordination
goals: Centralize all customer relationship data in one unified system
Streamline lead qualification and conversion to customers
Visualize and manage deal pipelines with automatic stage transitions
Track all customer activities, emails, calls, and meetings in one timeline
Automate repetitive tasks like lead assignment and follow-up reminders
Gain insights through dashboards and analytics on sales performance
target_audience.usage_context: Daily usage by sales teams during business hours (9am-6pm) for managing customer interactions, updating deal statuses, logging activities, and tracking pipeline progress. Access needed from office desktops and mobile devices for field sales reps. Critical during sales cycles, customer meetings, and pipeline review sessions.

product_vision.one_liner: A comprehensive CRM platform that unifies customer data, automates sales workflows, and provides real-time pipeline visibility to help sales teams close more deals faster.
product_vision.problem_statement: Sales teams struggle with fragmented customer data spread across emails, spreadsheets, and multiple tools, leading to missed opportunities, inefficient workflows, and lack of visibility into pipeline health. They need a unified system that centralizes customer relationships, automates lead conversion, and provides actionable insights.
product_vision.value_proposition: Unlike generic CRMs that require extensive customization, CoreOne CRM delivers industry-specific workflows out-of-the-box with Clean Architecture for easy extensibility. It combines Azure AD enterprise authentication, real-time SignalR notifications, sophisticated deal pipeline automation based on quotation status, and seamless integrations with SharePoint and Dynamics 365 - purpose-built for teams that need enterprise-grade security with startup-level agility.
success_metrics: Time to convert lead to customer reduced by 40%
Pipeline visibility - 100% of deals tracked with accurate stage information
User adoption rate - 80% daily active usage by sales team within 3 months
Data completeness - 90% of customer records have complete contact and activity data
Deal velocity - 25% reduction in average deal cycle time
Integration efficiency - 50% reduction in manual data entry through SharePoint/Dynamics integration

existing_features: Complete authentication and authorization system with Azure AD integration
JWT-based auth with refresh token rotation and API key middleware
Frontend UI for all major modules: Dashboard, Customer, Lead, Deal, Contact, Activity
Deal pipeline visualization with drag-and-drop stage management
Clean Architecture implementation across all projects (Domain/Application/Infrastructure/API)
SignalR hub for real-time logout notifications
Axios interceptors with automatic token refresh
CRM Category API module (only backend API implemented)
Mock data layer for frontend development
Lead conversion workflow UI (Lead → Customer → Deal)
Activity management interface with calendar integration
Material-UI component library with custom theming
known_gaps: Backend APIs missing for Customer, Lead, Deal, Contact, Activity modules - CRITICAL BLOCKER
Database integration incomplete - only Auth API connected to MySQL
No quotation management API despite UI being ready
SharePoint and Dynamics 365 integrations configured but not fully tested
Real-time notifications (SignalR) only implemented for logout, not for CRM events
Advanced search and filtering APIs not developed
No automated testing for frontend components
technical_debt: Frontend using mock data instead of real API calls - needs refactoring when APIs ready
Database schema references in docs mention PostgreSQL but actual implementation uses MySQL (documentation inconsistency)
Some API client modules created but not connected to actual endpoints
Shared NuGet packages (Res.Shared.AuthN, Res.Shared.AuthZ) referenced but not all projects use them consistently
Logging configuration differs between CRM API and Auth API - needs standardization
Certificate management requires manual setup for each developer (mkcert process)
Environment variable management across 3 projects needs centralization
CORS configuration duplicated across backend APIs
Repository pattern implemented but no caching layer for frequently accessed data
No database migration strategy defined (currently using Init.sql scripts)
Test coverage very low - only basic unit tests in CRMApi.UnitTests

alternatives: Salesforce - Enterprise CRM leader with extensive features but high cost and complexity
HubSpot CRM - Free tier popular with SMBs, strong marketing automation
Microsoft Dynamics 365 - Deep Microsoft ecosystem integration, enterprise-focused
Pipedrive - Sales-focused CRM with intuitive pipeline management
Zoho CRM - Affordable option with broad feature set for small-medium businesses
differentiators: Clean Architecture with true separation of concerns - easier to customize and extend than monolithic competitors
Built-in Azure AD enterprise authentication (most competitors charge extra for SSO)
Real-time SignalR notifications for instant team collaboration
Automatic deal stage transitions based on quotation status - reduces manual updates
Native SharePoint and Dynamics 365 integration for Microsoft-centric organizations
Self-hosted option with full data ownership vs SaaS-only competitors
Tailored for specific industry workflows rather than generic one-size-fits-all
Open architecture allows unlimited customization without vendor lock-in
HTTPS-first development environment with proper certificate management
competitive_context.market_position: Positioned as an enterprise-grade CRM for mid-market companies (50-500 employees) in the Microsoft ecosystem who need Salesforce-level capabilities with Pipedrive-level usability, while maintaining full control over their data and customization. Target customers are growth-stage B2B companies with complex sales cycles who have outgrown basic CRMs but find enterprise solutions too rigid and expensive.

technical: Must maintain Clean Architecture pattern across all new features
MySQL database already chosen - migration to another DB would be costly
Dapper ORM with SimpleCRUD - limited compared to Entity Framework for complex queries
React 18 frontend - must stay compatible with Material-UI v7 ecosystem
Azure AD integration dependency - requires Azure tenant setup for customers
HTTPS required for local development - adds setup complexity for new developers
Shared NuGet packages (Res.Shared.AuthN) are local DLLs, not published to NuGet.org
SignalR requires WebSocket support - may have issues with some proxies/firewalls
Three separate projects (frontend, CRM API, Auth API) must be run simultaneously for development
Certificate management (mkcert) requires manual installation on each developer machine
resources: Solo developer (hiepcp) - limited bandwidth for parallel feature development
No dedicated QA team - testing must be developer-driven
No DevOps/infrastructure team - deployment and CI/CD are developer responsibilities
Limited time for documentation - focus on code quality over extensive docs
Development happens incrementally - need to prioritize high-value features first
dependencies: Azure AD tenant for authentication (customer-specific setup required)
MySQL database server must be running locally or accessible remotely
SharePoint instance for document management integration
Microsoft Dynamics 365 instance for category synchronization
mkcert for SSL certificate generation in development
Node.js/npm ecosystem for frontend build and development
Git for version control and collaboration
